page.title: 11LAKES
page.content: {Hawley Lake}is an extensive area owned by the Crown but it is used mainly for training by the Royal Engineers (see TRAINING AREAS).On the north side of the lake there are many Army buildings. The rest of the lake is surrounded by coniferous woodland and rhododendrons. In wet weather, the surrounding land can become boggy. The lake has an area of 16 ha and is fairly shallow. This shallowness causes problems for the sailing club, who use the lake. Sailing can take place at all times in parts of the lake, depending on the Army. There is a boathouse and clubhouse near the Army area. The club is an Army establishment, with higher membership fees for civilians. The lake is also used for fishing, if the anglers have a permit.(See also SAILING).
